name: market for deinked pulp, wet lap | deinked pulp, wet lap | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11136/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for 'deinked pulp, wet lap', in the Global geography. This is a constrained market for consequential system model, for attributional system models, this is a regular market. In the case of consequential system model, details about the marginal consumer can be found in the comment of the conditional exchange (by-product).;No transport or losses are considered in the modelling of this market, as producers and consumers are not physically separated.;The product “deinked pulp, wet lap” is a type of bleached, recycled pulp made from wastepaper fibres. Production includes a deinking process, i.e. the removal pf ink from the wastepaper input.  In the ecoinvent database, deinked pulp is used for the production of wood free paper.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'deinked pulp, wet lap',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of  deinked pulp, wet lap', to the consumers of this product. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
